Detailed Description

This class supplies basic functions for getting access to neural netwoks stored in chromosome.

Access operations include reading out the networks for mutation and again save the networks back to the chromosom.

Member Function Documentation

Individual Ops_Basic::createEmpty (  const unsigned    nIn,
const unsigned    nHid,
const unsigned    nOut,
const unsigned    nDelay
) 
 

Creat an new individual for representing a network.

Define a generic network by defining the number of input, hidden and output nodes. For generating recurrent networks, a parameter
nDelay is also needed, whereas if feedforward networks are to be created, this should be fixed to 1. Finally, two three-dimensional matrices of the size nDelay*(nIn+nHid+nOut)*(nDelay+nIn+nHid+nOut) will be generated.

Parameters:
nIn:  number of input nodes
nHid:  number of hidden nodes
nOut:  number of output nodes
nDelay:  number of time delay

void Ops_Basic::delNeuron (  Individual &    Ind,
unsigned    N
)  [protected]
 

Delete a hidden neuron according to a given number.

All hidden neurons are enumerated so that an arbitrary hidden neuron can be determined by an integer number.

Parameters:
Ind:  individual to be processed
N:  the neuron to be deleted

void Ops_Basic::jogWeights (  Individual &    Ind,
const double    stdv,
double    prob = 1.0
) 
 

Mutate the weights.

The weights are mutated using a normal distribution with a given propabability.

Parameters:
Ind:  individual to be mutated
stdv:  standard diviation of the normal distribution
prob:  mutation probability

void Ops_Basic::setNHid (  Individual &    Ind,
unsigned    nHid
)  [protected]
 

Change the number of hidden nodes according to a given number.

Only the length of the chromosome is changes, the connection and weight matrices remain unchanged.

Parameters:
Ind:  individual to be changed
nHid:  intended number of hidden nodes
